result.execSummary:
The defendant Josiah H Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Defendant is not to be in possession of a dangerous weapon during the period of probation.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with Pick'N'Save or the employee listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Defendant to comply with his current group home placement.
The knife seized is forfeited and can be destroyed pursuant to statute by the holding agency.
Comply with all Mental Health treatment and medications.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit and Billing Statement, by Dr. Collins for evaluations ordered by the court.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Josiah H Krueger in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.


Court orders the following:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with:  Pick'N'Save or employee listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Comply with all Mental Heath treatment and medications.
Defendant is not to be in possession of a dangerous weapon during the period of probation.
Defendant to comply with his current group home placement.

Knife seized is forfeited and can be destroyed pursuant to statute by the holding agency.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-10-2015 02:30 pm

Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Josiah H Krueger in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  

State and Defense have a copy of Dr. Collins NGI Evaluation.
Dr. Collins evaluation does not support an NGI.
State and Defense do not contest/challenge the Evaluation.

Based on the Evaluation the court finds the Defendant is not meet the criteria for an NGI plea.
Matter will proceed to Plea and Sentencing.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
filed by Dr. Collins

Order for Examination under 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect).
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 09/16/15.
Hearing at 10-26-2015 10:30 am

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Josiah H Krueger in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  

Defense request to enter an NGI plea and requests an evaluation.
Court orders an Evaluation underf 971.16.
Court appoints Dr. Deborah Collins to do the evaluation on an out patient basis.
Evaluation to be filed by:  10/15/2015
  Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 10:30 am.
